报告摘要
: Much of the developmental complexity of higher eukaryotes is thought to arise from gene regulation. RNA represents a hidden layer of regulatory information in complex organisms. I will discuss our recent progresses in exploring novel functions of genomic repeats, lncRNA, and RNA-binding protein in the regulation of transcription and genome organization.
